top_categories.workout_context: Gravel Rocks' UK North York Moors, British gravel forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 55 miles.
73ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At Gravel Rocks, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Gravel Rocks' demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before July.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Gravel Rocks. Train it until it feels boring.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Gravel Rocks, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Varied gradients on uK North York Moors gravel demand climbing versatility. Sit the shallow stuff, stand the steep stuff, switch without thinking.
When someone attacks on uK North York Moors gravel, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
55 miles on uK North York Moors gravel burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on uK North York Moors gravel. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.
Smooth pedaling at 55 miles saves muscle. Bad technique at mile 10 is invisible. At mile 80 it's a cramp.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Gravel Rocks’s 55 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Gravel Rocks requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on uk north york moors gravel to build confidence. Expect: uk north york moors, british gravel, uk.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, TT Threshold, and Over Under to prepare you for 55 miles of uk north york moors gravel in North York Moors, UK.
